title: Rugby World Cup 2019: Kick-off time and TV info for Australia vs Georgia
text:
Follow live updates from the Rugby World Cup as Australia and Georgia go head to head in their final match of the group stages.

The Wallabies have already secured progression to the quarter-finals but will be looking to end their Pool D campaign with a flourish when they take on the Europeans.

Michael Cheika’s side currently sit in second on 11 points, having only lost to Wales so far. As it currently stands, they’re set to face England in the last eight. A win for Georgia, meanwhile, will likely secure them third place, and automatic qualification for the 2023 World Cup in France. Follow our rolling coverage below:

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

Teams Australia XV: Beale; Petaia, O'Connor, Kerevi, Koroibete; Toomua, White; Sio, Latu, Kepu, Rodda, Arnold, Dempsey, Pocock (capt), Naisarani.

Georgia XV: Matiashvili; Kveseladze, Kacharava, Sharikadze, Todua; Khmaladze, Aprasidze; Nariashvili, Mamukashvili, Gigashvili, Nemsadze, Mikautadze, Saginadze, Gorgodze, Gorgadze.

Hello all and welcome to The Independent's live coverage of this morning's Rugby World Cup clash between hosts Australia and Georgia.



I'll be bringing you all the live action, reaction and analysis - so make sure to stay tuned!

When is it?

Australia vs Georgia kicks off at 11.15 BST (7.15pm Japan Standard Time) on Friday 11 October.

Where can I watch it?

The match will be broadcast on ITV4. Alternatively, you can live stream it via the ITV Hub on your laptop, smartphone or tablet.
description: Follow live updates from the Rugby World Cup as Australia and Georgia go head to head in their final match of the group stages. The Wallabies have already secured progression to the quarter-finals but will be looking to end their Pool D campaign with a flourish when they take on the Europeans.
